    • Constructor Detail

      • View

        public View()
        The constructor of the view object. This object will communicate with the user by command line. It initializes both the input and output.

      • isValidDateTime

        protected boolean isValidDateTime(java.lang.String date)
        This method will check whether the given date string can be parsed or not to a DateTime.
        Parameters:
        date -
        Returns:
        Returns true if it is a correctly spelled date, else it returns false.

      • isValidInteger

        protected boolean isValidInteger(int integer)
        This method will check whether the given string can be parsed or not to an Integer.
        Parameters:
        integer -
        Returns:
        Returns true if it is an Integer (except for the MIN_VALUE of Integer), else it returns false.

      • isValidYesAnswer

        protected boolean isValidYesAnswer(java.lang.String answer)
        This method will check whether the given string is "y" or "yes" case insensitive.
        Parameters:
        answer -
        Returns:
        Returns true if the string is equal to "y" or "yes" (case insensitive), else it returns false.

      • isValidNoAnswer

        This method will check whether the given string is "n" or "no" case insensitive.
        Parameters:
        answer -
        Returns:
        Returns true if the string is equal to "n" or "no" (case insensitive), else it returns false.

      • getStringMinutes

        private java.lang.String getStringMinutes(int minutes)
        This method will parse the given minutes as integer to a string with days, hours and minutes. A day counts 8 hours and an hour counts 60 minutes.
        Parameters:
        minutes -
        Returns:
        Returns the minutes as a string of days, hours and minutes.

                     throws ShouldExitException
        Returns an integer representing the chosen object from the given list.
        Parameters:
        list - The given list to chose from.
        question - The question to accompany the input request.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of the chosen object from the given list.
        Throws:
        ShouldExitException - The choice of the user is to stop.

        Returns:

                      int tabs,
                      boolean printReturn)
        This method will print the given list of projects. The tabs integer is to enter the amount of indentation. The printReturn boolean is whether or not to print "0. Return" in front of the list.
